text: Led UI/UX design for a SaaS platform using Figma, shaping the Legato design system. Conducted usability tests and integrated data-driven research via FullStory. Managed projects with Atlassian, emphasizing Agile and Scrum methodologies. Notably improved design workflows, boosted user engagement, and aligned designs with key business objectives.

slides.bottomText: This showcase highlights our roadmap for the Security Design team's strategic development in FY24, meticulously designed to meet our business and organizational goals.

At Warner Music Group (WMG), I spearheaded the design of the Storybox desktop app (end-to-end), WMG's real-time platform for artist updates and marketing collaboration. This case study highlights a few assets of the journey, hurdles, insights, and results of the Storybox endeavor.

Storybox is WMG's central hub for marketing campaigns for artists like Cardi B and Coldplay. It's a collaboration tool where teams can find project details, timelines, team members, assets, and 'stories'â€”similar to social media posts with text, photos, or videos.

As Warner Music Group's lead product designer, I created the Storybox app. This case study highlights its evolution, challenges, and how we enhanced user experience based on Joshua Seiden's outcome-focused approach.

Addressing communication gaps, enhancing real-time project updates, improving Storybox's UX, introducing new tools and methods, navigating a complex design process, and championing change among stakeholders.

When I began with Storybox, I conducted a UX audit based on the Nielsen Norman Group's model and surveyed the PM, PO, and stakeholders. We were at Level 2, indicating sporadic UX efforts. I identified the need for both qualitative and quantitative research tools to enhance our UX maturity.
We introduced advanced tools and prioritized understanding user behavior. This became our success metric. Using data-driven design decisions, we enhanced outcomes and user experience.

In crafting Storybox, I prioritized user goals, set clear outcomes, used data-driven success metrics, tested prototypes with real users, refined designs based on feedback, and continually adapted to ensure we met evolving user needs.

I designed Storybox for users like Hanna, a local marketing manager wanting real-time campaign overviews; international specialists coordinating global campaigns; and regional managers seeking better global data sync, all to simplify communication and workflow.
After looking at problems, deciding which are most common, and brainstorming, we used what we learned about our users to guide how we design the app and choose its features.
After analyzing issues on the existing platform using heat maps and recordings, and identifying common problems, our user insights guided the design and feature selection for the app.
Using personas, usability interviews, and both quantitative and qualitative data, I began shaping the app's information architecture with my team.
Following our research, I developed wireframes and prototypes, which were then tested with users for further feedback.
The prototyping phase was rapid and vital, with iterations based on interview feedback. This provided deeper insights for a user-centric outcome approach.

After prototyping, we moved to high-fidelity designs. These detailed visuals captured the product's final appearance and interactions, serving as a blueprint for developers and ensuring an intuitive user experience.
Baseline measurements ensure pixel-perfect designs, aiding engineers in front-end development and contributing to WMG's Legato design library.
The central feature of Storybox was the 'stories', designed to replace email communication. These stories resembled social media posts, incorporating text, photos, or videos.
Storybox serves as a global hub where artists collaborate with regional teams.

For both desktop and mobile devices, we maintained a consistent approach from sketches to low and high-fidelity designs, followed by prototype testing. This consistency ensured an outcome-focused approach throughout.

We successfully launched Storybox, boosting internal communication and immediate campaign data access. Using an outcome-focused strategy, we set metrics such as employee time saved, reduced email usage, and user satisfaction, resulting in an estimated cost savings of 25.5%.

slides.text: I truly enjoyed my time at WMG, surrounded by a high caliber of designers and research gurus. The team was fantastic and fun to work with. Interested in this or other projects I've been a part of? I'd be happy to chat.
